title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Wednesday, 6 January 2016 - BBC News
summary: eight arrests made in connection to andrew bedford cold case murder .
large numbers of gp surgeries in east of england stop taking on new patients , bbc investigation reveals .
a health union has accused huntingdon mp jonathan djanogly of 'scaremongering ' over his criticism of hospital collaboration .
fenland couple raise £ 12,000 for cancer research from christmas lights display .
more news , sport , weather and travel from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage throughout the day
text: thanks for joining us .
that 's it for our live updates for today , but we 'll be back with the latest news , sport , weather and travel for cambridgeshire at 08:00 tomorrow .
have a good evening .

documents.title: weather : rain tonight , clearing to sunshine tomorrow
text: after a mainly dry start to the night , further outbreaks of rain will arrive from the west , reaching cambridgeshire in the early hours..
minimum temperature : 5c ( 41f ) .
tomorrow will see sunny spells and just the risk of a few showers for the afternoon .
it will feel increasingly chilly though , with fresh westerly winds .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
there 's more on the forecast where you live from bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: first day at nursery school for prince george
text: prince george of cambridge started nursery school today .
the duke and duchess of cambridge marked the moment by tweeting images of him arriving at westacre montessori school nursery in norfolk .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : eight arrested in 1990 murder probe cambridgeshire mep to lead eu-wide gun review
text: here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this evening :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: freeze on car parking charges in cambridge announced
text: car parking charges in cambridge are set to be frozen , but business permit and season ticket holders will pay more .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: cambridgeshire mep to lead eu-wide review of gun laws
text: east of england mep vicky ford is to lead an eu-wide review of gun laws following the terrorist attacks in paris .
the conservative mep will scrutinise the current proposals and make amendments ahead of a vote later in the year .
she is set to hold a meeting with firearms experts at the imperial war museum , at duxford , on friday .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: twelth night sees lights come down at 'million ' bulb display home
text: in case you 've forgotten today is twelth night , the traditional time to take down your christmas decorations.. no small task for robert and amanda dempsey who have been dismantling the one million bulb display at their home in the village of turves .
the couple say thousands of people travelled to their fenland home to see the display , whihc they believe was the biggest in east anglia .
the couple raised over £ 12,000 for cancer research .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pcc to recommend one per cent increase in policing council tax element
text: cambridgeshire 's police and crime commissioner , sir graham bright , says he will recommend a 1 % increase to the policing element of the council tax for 2016/17 .
the proposed increase equates to an extra 3.5p per week on a band d property .
the conservative pcc , who will not be seeking re-election this year , says cambridgeshire police will still `` be able to `` balance the books '' if the recommendation is approved .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'scorcher ' winter weather explained
text: we 've just had the warmest december on record , but what caused it to happen ?
look east weather forecaster dan holley explains

documents.title: police hunt for large bird on the loose in terrington st clement area
text: police have been searching for a large bird which was reported to be on the loose in the terrington st clement area .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: victorian bakers struggle with the dough at sacrewell mill
text: in the first episode of victorian bakers the bakers struggled to turn their authentic dough into cottage loves in the bakery at sacrewell mill in cambridgeshire..
here 's a sneak preview of what awaits them next week .
the new bbc series challenging four modern bakers to a victorian-style bake-off using traditional recipes and equipment .
you can see the next episode on bbc two next tuesday .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: syd barrett 70th : family help launch official website for pink floyd legend
text: pink floyd 's syd barrett was born in cambridge 70 years ago today .
to mark the anniversary his family have helped launch an official website dedicated to the musical legend .
born roger keith barrett , on 6 january 1945 , he was pink floyd 's main songwriter during their early success , but parted company with the band in 1968 , and returned to live in cambridge .
he died in the city in 2006 .
syd 's nephew ian barrett said : we hope that in keeping with my uncle 's talents , this online resource will act as a springboard , inspiring a new generation of artists . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: andrew bedford murder arrests : what we know so far
text: here 's what we know so far about today 's arrests in connection with the 1990 murder of andrew bedford :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: date set for unveiling of cambridge syd barrett artwork memorial
text: a cambridge artwork honouring pink floyd 's syd barrett should be completed by october , the people behind it say .
the artwork will be sited in the cambridge corn exchange venue , one of the main music venues in the city , run by the organisation cambridge live .
speaking today , on the 70th anniversary of the musicians birth in the city , neil jones from cambridge live said it would reflect his `` genius '' .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : . a mostly cloudy afternoon with the odd shower
text: it will be a mostly cloudy afternoon with the odd shower .
feeling a little more chilly than of late with a maximum temperature of 8c ( 46f ) .
this of grey skies over peterborough was taken this morning by bbc weather watcher 'kev 's place ' .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: hinchingbrooke a & e 'vulnerable ' in hospital collaboration
text: a consultant says he fears hinchingbrooke hospital 's a & e services could be `` vulnerable '' to closure in a joint review of services by hinchingbrooke and peterborough hospitals .
the two trusts announced they will be looking at ways to `` collaborate clinically '' and review `` potential organisational form '' .
dr nic clarke , who stood as the labour parliamentary candidate for huntingdon , says he would `` absolutely '' have a problem with clinical services being shared .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: andrew bedford murder arrests : police begin questioning
text: seven of the people arrested this morning over the murder of andrew bedford are being questioned at march police station .
police say a 56-year-old man , arrested in southampton on sus of murder and conspiracy to prevent lawful burial , will be questioned in custody there .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : police investigating 1990 murder of andrew bedford make eight arrests syd barrett 70th marked in cambridge
text: if you are just joining us , here are the headlines this afternoon :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: andrew bedford murder : arrests follow april relaunch of investigation
text: the eight arrests today were made as part of a murder investigation re-launched on april 10 last year , which led to the discovery of bones in ramsey ( below ) close to where andrew bedford was last seen .
the other four people arrested are :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: andrew bedford cold case murder : police release details of arrests
text: police have released details this morning of eight people arrested in connection with the 1990 murder of andrew bedford , from huntingdon .
they include :
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: andrew bedford cold case : arrests made in cambridgeshire , kent and hertfordshire
text: police have arrested seven people over the 1990 murder of andrew beford , from huntingdon .

seven men - from the peterborough , ramsey , northamptonshire , kent , hertfordshire and the southampton area have been taken to march police station for questioning - along with a woman from peterborough .
mr bedford , 27 , from huntingdon , was last seen in ramsey in cambridgeshire on 28 september 1990 .

documents.title: breakingandrew bedford cold case muder : police make eight arrests
text: detectives investigating the andrew bedford cold case murder have arrested eight people .
more to follow
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : striker ben williamson unlikely to return to cambridge
text: striker ben williamson looks unlikely to return to cambridge united , despite making an impression while on loan from gillingham .
the 27-year-old scored three goals during his recent spell at the abbey stadium , but gillingham manager justin edinburgh says he 's a big part of their own plans .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: fenland couple 's 'million ' bulb christmas light display raises £ 12k
text: robert and amanda dempsey from turves say their one million bulb christmas light display has raised .
£ 12,000 in donations for cancer research .
the couple have begun the mammoth task of taking down the display at their two-acre fenland property , but are already making plans for next christmas .
they were inspired to raise money for cancer research uk , following the death of mr dempsey 's mother .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : sacrewell mill appears in victorian baking challenge
text: cambridgeshire 's grade ii-listed sacrewell mill featured in a new bbc two series last night , challenging four modern bakers to use traditional recipes and equipment .
episode one of victorian bakers was filmed at the 18th century watermill near peterborough .
if you missed it you can catch up on the bbc iplayer .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: concerns after man found dead in march
text: a man in his 70s was reported to have laid dead for days in a march sheltered housing complex before being found by his neighbours .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: union accuses mp of 'scaremongering ' over hospital collaboration criticism
text: unison have accused huntingdon mp jonathan djanogly of `` scaremongering '' after he criticised plans for hinchingbrooke and peterborough city hospitals to work more more collaboratively to save money .
the conservative mp said he had `` grave concerns '' the joint review would lead to the loss of services at hinchingbrooke .
but jo rust from unison , the union that represents health workers , told bbc radio cambridgeshire she hoped it would improve conditions for staff at the huntingdon hospital .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman injured in four vehicle a14 crash
text: the ambulance service say nobody was seriously injured on the four car crash on the a14 , near bar hill , this morning .
a woman in her 40s was treated for a minor chest injury , but was not taken to hospital .
one lane remains closed eastbound and traffic is queued back to j24 for godmanchester .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : reports of crash on m11 northbound near whittlesford
text: there 's been another incident on cambridgeshire 's roads this morning : police are responding to reports of an accident on the m11 northbound near whittlesford .
we are responding to a report of an accident on the # m11 northbound carriageway near to # whittlesford .
car in carriageway .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: gp surgeries reach new patient 'breaking point '
text: large numbers of gp surgeries in england have stopped taking on new patients or have applied to do so , a bbc investigation has found .
the british medical association ( bma ) says many are at `` breaking point '' as they struggle to fill staff vacancies .
dr james morrow , from sawston and linton medical practices in south cambridgeshire , says the two surgeries have decided to `` future proof '' themselves by merging and pooling resources .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : long delays after four vehicle crash on a14 at bar hill
text: there are long delays on the a14 , eastbound , following a four vehicle crash near bar hill .
update - # a14 eastbound - incident at j29 ( bar hill ) causing long delays back to j24 ( godmanchester ) .
seek alternative .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: arsonists destroy cambridge school 's playground equipment
text: the return to lessons proved particularly difficult for students at a cambridge school this week , as they came to terms with a devastating arson attack .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: headlines : health union accuses huntingdon mp of 'scaremongering ' over hospital collaboration 'million light ' christmas display raises £ 12k
text: here are the headlines for cambridgeshire :
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

text: any early mist and fog patches will clear during the morning .
some bright spells are likely , particularly in western parts such as huntingdon .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
head to bbc weather for a more detailed forecast for where you live .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: travel : a14 partially blocked eastbound at bar hill
text: the a14 is partially blocked eastbound near bar hill following a crash involving four vehicles .
# a14 eastbound at j29 ( bar hill ) - lanes partially blocked due to incident .
expect delays .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: welcome to local live for cambridgeshire
text: we 'll be here until 18:00 with the latest news , sport , travel and weather for the county .
you can get involved by sending us your stories and .
time via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live
